intro: Seseli viarum, commonly known as the narrowleaf seseli, is a flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. Native to the Mediterranean region, it thrives in rocky or sandy soils and full sun. The plant typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and along roadsides.
